{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=2009 |Team=Central Michigan Chippewas |Image=CentralMichiganChippewas.png |Conference=Mid-American Conference |Division=West Division |ShortConference=MAC |CoachRank=24 |APRank=23 |Record=12â2 |ConfRecord=8â0 |HeadCoach=[[Butch Jones]] |OffCoach=Mike Bajakian |DefCoach=Tim Banks |OScheme= |DScheme= |StadiumArena=[[Kelly/Shorts Stadium]] |Champion=GMAC Bowl Champions
Mid-American Conference Champions
MAC West Division Champions |BowlTourney=[[2010 GMAC Bowl|GMAC Bowl]] |BowlTourneyResult=W 44â41 vs. [[2009 Troy Trojans football team|Troy]] |ConfChamp=[[2009 MAC Championship Game|MAC Championship Game]] |ConfChampResult= W 20â10 vs. [[2009 Ohio Bobcats football team|Ohio]] }} {{2009 Mid-American Conference football standings}} The '''2009 [[Central Michigan Chippewas|Central Michigan University Chippewas]] [[Central Michigan Chippewas football|football team]]''' represented [[Central Michigan University]] in the college football season of [[2009 NCAA Division I FBS football season|2009]]. They competed in [[National Collegiate Athletic Association]] (NCAA) [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] [[Division I (NCAA)#Football Bowl Subdivision|Football Bowl Subdivision]] (FBS) [[college football]] during the football season. Central Michigan competed as a member of the [[Mid-American Conference]] (MAC) West Division. The team was coached by [[Butch Jones]] and played their home games in [[Kelly/Shorts Stadium]]. The Chippewas finished the regular season 11â2 and 8â0 in conference play, beat [[2009 Ohio Bobcats football team|Ohio]] in the [[2009 MAC Championship Game]] to win the MAC title and were invited to the [[2010 GMAC Bowl|GMAC Bowl]] where they defeated [[Sun Belt Conference|Sun Belt]] Champion [[2009 Troy Trojans football team|Troy]] 44â41 in double overtime. At the end of the season Jones departed CMU to become the head coach of the [[Cincinnati Bearcats football|University of Cincinnati]]. Steve Stripling, the defensive ends coach, became interim head coach and coached the GMAC bowl.{{cite news | title=http://www.mlive.com/chippewas/index.ssf/2010/01/cmu_could_announce_new_footbal.html | publisher=''[[Saginaw News]]'' | first=Hugh | last=Bernreuter | date=January 9, 2010 | accessdate=2010-01-10 | url=http://www.mlive.com/chippewas/index.ssf/2010/01/cmu_could_announce_new_footbal.html}} ==Before the season== ===Recruiting=== {{College Athlete Recruit Start|40=yes|collapse=yes|year=2009}} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Justice Akuezue | position = DE | hometown = Ann Arbor, MI | highschool = Huron HS | feet = 6 | inches = 3 | weight = 204 | 40 = 4.5 | commitdate = 2008-07-30 | scout stars = 2 | rivals stars = 2 | espn grade = 40 }} {{College Athlete Recruit Entry | recruit = Deja Alexander | position = WR | hometown = Jacksonville, FL | highschool = First Coast HS | feet = 6 | inches = 1 | weight = 185 | 40 = -
